Class Background

java.lang.Object
Background
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Background
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
This class represents the board in the game, It's main purpose is to build a gui which can be used to move the squirrels that have been placed on the board. It is also used to store any variables which might need to be shared between the squirrels.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Background()
    Constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
    Determines the response given when each of the buttons on the game board is pressed, each of the directional buttons will move the active squirrel, while selecting a gridbutton that shows the head of a squirrel will make it into the active squirrel.
    void addBlackSquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)  
    void addBrownSquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)  
    void addGreySquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)  
    void addRedSquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)
    Takes a squirrel object as a parameter and adds it to the active squirrels on the board only one of each colour squirrel is allowed and the colour is determined by which method is called.
    boolean checkCleared()
    Checks if every active squirrel has dropped it's nut in one of the holes on the board, returning a boolean which determines whether the game has been cleared.
    void createFlower​(int location)
    Used to create a hole-blocking flower at the specified location.
    Background getBackground()
    Provides this object to the function to be used in other classes.
    java.lang.Integer[] getFilledHoles()
    Returns an array of the filled holes on this game board.
    int getflowerLocation()
    Getter function which returns the location of the hole-blocking flower
    javax.swing.JButton[] getgridButton()
    Provides the array of gridbuttons to another function.
    java.lang.Integer[] getObstacles()
    Creates a list of all the active obstacles on the board, obstacles are given specific indexes so that they may be referenced individually at other points.
    void setFilledHoles​(java.lang.Integer filledHole)
    A function which takes as a parameter the index of a gridbutton that has just had a nut been slotted into its hole, This function will then add the location of that filled hole to an array which stores what holes are filled and which squirrel filled that hole.
    void setSquirrel​(Squirrel squirrel)
    Sets the clicked squirrel as the 'active' squirrel to be moved by the directional buttons.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Background

      public Background()
      Constructor. Creates a new instance of the Background class which creates the empty board used in the game.

  • Method Details

    • createFlower

      public void createFlower​(int location)
      Used to create a hole-blocking flower at the specified location.
      Parameters:
      location - The index of the gridbutton the flower will occupy.

    • addRedSquirrel

      public void addRedSquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)
      Takes a squirrel object as a parameter and adds it to the active squirrels on the board only one of each colour squirrel is allowed and the colour is determined by which method is called.
      Parameters:
      newSquirrel - The squirrel object being added to the background class

      public void addBlackSquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)

      public void addGreySquirrel​(Squirrel newSquirrel)

    • checkCleared

      public boolean checkCleared()
      Checks if every active squirrel has dropped it's nut in one of the holes on the board, returning a boolean which determines whether the game has been cleared.

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Determines the response given when each of the buttons on the game board is pressed, each of the directional buttons will move the active squirrel, while selecting a gridbutton that shows the head of a squirrel will make it into the active squirrel.
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

    • getObstacles

      public java.lang.Integer[] getObstacles()
      Creates a list of all the active obstacles on the board, obstacles are given specific indexes so that they may be referenced individually at other points.

    • getgridButton

      public javax.swing.JButton[] getgridButton()
      Provides the array of gridbuttons to another function.

    • getBackground

      public Background getBackground()
      Provides this object to the function to be used in other classes.

    • getFilledHoles

      public java.lang.Integer[] getFilledHoles()
      Returns an array of the filled holes on this game board.

    • getflowerLocation

      public int getflowerLocation()
      Getter function which returns the location of the hole-blocking flower

    • setSquirrel

      public void setSquirrel​(Squirrel squirrel)
      Sets the clicked squirrel as the 'active' squirrel to be moved by the directional buttons.

    • setFilledHoles

      public void setFilledHoles​(java.lang.Integer filledHole)
      A function which takes as a parameter the index of a gridbutton that has just had a nut been slotted into its hole, This function will then add the location of that filled hole to an array which stores what holes are filled and which squirrel filled that hole. This prevents multiple squirrels dropping nuts into the same hole.
